leaf_cluster_name: 核科学与核聚变计算生态
typical_objects: 等离子体场, 粒子分布, 磁约束几何, 诊断信号, 输运方程
task_chain: 建模→仿真→诊断/反演→控制/优化→验证→工作流
tool_form: 大型仿真器 + 诊断/反演工具 + 控制/优化 + HPC

tools.name: ebhlight
tools.one_line_profile: Two-temperature General Relativistic Radiation Magnetohydrodynamics code
tools.detailed_description: A general relativistic radiation magnetohydrodynamics (GRRMHD) code that evolves the equations of GRMHD with a two-temperature fluid approximation, developed by the AFD group at Illinois.

tools.name: grim
tools.one_line_profile: General Relativistic Implicit Magnetohydrodynamics solver
tools.detailed_description: A code for General Relativistic Implicit Magnetohydrodynamics (GRIM), designed to handle stiff source terms and diverse equations of state for astrophysical simulations.

tools.name: kharma
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos-based High-Accuracy Relativistic Magnetohydrodynamics with AMR
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable GRMHD code using Kokkos and Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR), capable of running on CPUs and GPUs for high-accuracy astrophysical simulations.

tools.name: piccante
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel fully-relativistic 3D particle-in-cell code
tools.detailed_description: A fully-relativistic electromagnetic 3D Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for massive parallelism, used for simulating laser-plasma interactions and particle acceleration.

tools.name: Emu
tools.one_line_profile: Neutrino quantum kinetics simulation code based on PIC method
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code for neutrino quantum kinetics using the Particle-in-Cell method, parallelized for CPU and GPU architectures via the AMReX framework.

tools.name: ARTEMIS
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh Refinement Time-domain ElectrodynaMIcs Solver
tools.detailed_description: A solver coupling Maxwell's equations from WarpX with classical equations for quantum materials (LLG, London equations) to simulate next-generation microelectronics and superconducting materials.

tools.name: demon_simulation_code
tools.one_line_profile: 2D molecular dynamics simulation of dust in dusty plasmas
tools.detailed_description: A Molecular Dynamics (MD) simulation code specifically designed for studying the behavior of dust particles in dusty plasma environments.

tools.name: VisualPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Data Visualization for Particle-in-Cell Codes
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based visualization tool designed specifically for analyzing and rendering data output from Particle-in-Cell (PIC) plasma simulation codes.

tools.name: ImpactX
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance modeling of beam dynamics in particle accelerators
tools.detailed_description: A code for modeling beam dynamics in particle accelerators, accounting for collective effects, built on the AMReX framework for high-performance computing.

tools.name: WarpX
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code
tools.detailed_description: An advanced, massively parallel electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell (PIC) code designed for exascale simulations of plasma physics and particle accelerators.

tools.name: iPic3D
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell code using the implicit moment method
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulation code that employs the implicit moment method to allow for larger time steps and grid spacing in plasma simulations.

tools.name: PIConGPU
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-Portable Particle-in-Cell Simulations for the Exascale Era
tools.detailed_description: A fully relativistic, many-core Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for running on GPUs and other accelerators, enabling large-scale plasma physics simulations.

tools.name: PICSAR
tools.one_line_profile: Library of modular physics routines for PIC codes
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Fortran/Python library providing optimized modular physics routines (current deposition, field gathering, etc.) to accelerate Particle-In-Cell (PIC) codes.

tools.name: CabanaPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Structured PIC proxy app based on Cabana
tools.detailed_description: A proxy application for Particle-in-Cell simulations built on the Cabana library, designed to evaluate performance portability and particle algorithms on modern architectures.

tools.name: FARGO3D
tools.one_line_profile: Multifluid HD/MHD code for protoplanetary disks
tools.detailed_description: A versatile multifluid Hydrodynamic (HD) and Magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) code that runs on CPU/GPU clusters, specialized for simulating protoplanetary disks and fluid dynamics.

tools.name: FreeGSNKE
tools.one_line_profile: Evolutive free-boundary tokamak plasma equilibrium simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python code for simulating evolutive free-boundary tokamak plasma equilibrium, solving the Grad-Shafranov equation with kinetic effects.

tools.name: GKV
tools.one_line_profile: Gyrokinetic Vlasov simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A flux-tube gyrokinetic Vlasov simulation code designed to study plasma turbulence and transport in magnetic confinement fusion devices.

tools.name: nata
tools.one_line_profile: Python visualization and post-processing library for PIC codes
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for post-processing and visualizing data from Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations, supporting various file formats and providing an interactive interface.

tools.name: Hi-PACE
tools.one_line_profile: Highly efficient quasistatic particle-in-cell code for plasma accelerator emulation
tools.detailed_description: Hi-PACE is a quasistatic particle-in-cell (PIC) code designed for the efficient simulation of plasma-based particle accelerators. It leverages GPU acceleration and advanced algorithms to model wakefield acceleration processes.

tools.name: AthenaK
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable astrophysical AMR-MHD code using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: AthenaK is a performance-portable rewrite of the Athena++ astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code. It utilizes the Kokkos library to run efficiently on various hardware architectures (CPUs, GPUs) and supports adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) for high-resolution simulations.

tools.name: IPPL
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for performance-portable particle and mesh simulations
tools.detailed_description: The Independent Parallel Particle Layer (IPPL) is a C++ framework designed for developing parallel particle-in-cell (PIC) and continuum applications. It provides data parallel abstractions for fields and particles, supporting fully Eulerian, Lagrangian, or hybrid methods.

tools.name: SymPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Symplectic Particle-in-Cell code for plasma simulation
tools.detailed_description: SymPIC is a Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code that employs symplectic integrators to ensure long-term energy conservation and stability in plasma simulations. It is designed for studying kinetic plasma phenomena.

tools.name: FusionFormulary.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for calculating plasma physics and fusion energy parameters
tools.detailed_description: FusionFormulary.jl implements formulas from the NRL Plasma Formulary and Magnetic Fusion Energy Formulary. It provides utilities for calculating fundamental plasma parameters, transport coefficients, and other quantities relevant to fusion research.

tools.name: JustPIC.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell advection schemes in Julia
tools.detailed_description: JustPIC.jl provides implementations of Particle-in-Cell advection methods tailored for geodynamics and potentially other continuum mechanics problems, leveraging Julia's performance capabilities.

tools.name: GEMPIC.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric ElectroMagnetic Particle-In-Cell method implementation
tools.detailed_description: GEMPIC.jl implements Geometric ElectroMagnetic Particle-In-Cell methods, focusing on structure-preserving algorithms for solving the Vlasov-Maxwell system in plasma physics.

tools.name: ParticleInCell.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Basic Particle-In-Cell code written in Julia
tools.detailed_description: ParticleInCell.jl is a Julia implementation of standard Particle-In-Cell algorithms for plasma simulation, serving as a tool for kinetic plasma modeling.

tools.name: VlasovSolvers.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Suite of solvers for the Vlasov equation in Julia
tools.detailed_description: VlasovSolvers.jl provides a collection of numerical methods for solving the Vlasov equation, which describes the time evolution of the distribution function of plasma consisting of charged particles with long-range interaction.

tools.name: Freljord-CFD-Library
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Discontinuous Galerkin and WENO methods in CFD
tools.detailed_description: Freljord-CFD-Library contains Fortran implementations of Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) and Weighted Essentially Non-Oscillatory (WENO) schemes for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations.

tools.name: afivo-streamer
tools.one_line_profile: Plasma fluid simulation code for streamer discharges
tools.detailed_description: afivo-streamer is a simulation code designed to model streamer discharges in plasma using fluid approximations. It utilizes the Afivo framework for adaptive mesh refinement.

tools.name: MFEFormulary
tools.one_line_profile: Source code for the Magnetic Fusion Energy Formulary
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the source code and build system for the Magnetic Fusion Energy Formulary, providing a reference for formulas and data used in magnetic fusion research.

tools.name: MHDFlows.jl
tools.one_line_profile: 3D MHD pseudospectral solvers in Julia
tools.detailed_description: MHDFlows.jl provides three-dimensional Magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) solvers using pseudospectral methods. It is built upon FourierFlows.jl and is designed for simulating conducting fluids in magnetic fields.

tools.name: simLIBS
tools.one_line_profile: Python tool for simulating LIBS spectra using NIST database
tools.detailed_description: simLIBS is a Python library that simulates Laser-Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy (LIBS) spectra. It interfaces with the NIST LIBS Database to generate synthetic spectra for plasma spectroscopy applications.

tools.name: VERTEX-CFD
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-physics CFD solver for fusion applications
tools.detailed_description: VERTEX-CFD is a computational fluid dynamics solver specifically designed for multi-physics problems in fusion energy applications, such as liquid metal flows and blanket cooling.

tools.name: PHARE
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Hybrid Particle-in-Cell code with Adaptive Mesh Refinement
tools.detailed_description: PHARE is a hybrid Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code that models ions as kinetic particles and electrons as a fluid. It features Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) to efficiently resolve multi-scale plasma physics phenomena.

tools.name: DESC
tools.one_line_profile: Stellarator Equilibrium and Optimization Suite
tools.detailed_description: DESC is a code for solving 3D MHD equilibrium and performing optimization for stellarators. It uses pseudospectral methods and automatic differentiation to enable fast and accurate equilibrium calculations and design optimization.

tools.name: FAROES
tools.one_line_profile: Fusion analysis, research, and optimization for energy systems
tools.detailed_description: FAROES is a Python package for the analysis and optimization of fusion energy systems, focusing on tokamak power plant design and costing.

tools.name: FOCUS
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible Optimized Coils Using Space curves
tools.detailed_description: FOCUS is a code for designing and optimizing magnetic coils for stellarators and other magnetic confinement devices. It uses a space curve representation for coils to optimize for physics properties and engineering constraints.

tools.name: SPEC
tools.one_line_profile: Stepped-Pressure Equilibrium Code for MRxMHD
tools.detailed_description: SPEC (Stepped-Pressure Equilibrium Code) is an advanced MHD equilibrium solver that allows for magnetic islands and chaotic field regions by solving the Multi-Region Relaxed MHD (MRxMHD) equations.

tools.name: STELLOPT
tools.one_line_profile: Stellarator optimization code suite
tools.detailed_description: STELLOPT is a comprehensive suite of codes for optimizing stellarator configurations. It integrates equilibrium solvers (like VMEC) with various optimization algorithms to design magnetic confinement devices with desired physics properties.

tools.name: Athena++
tools.one_line_profile: Radiation GRMHD code and AMR framework
tools.detailed_description: Athena++ is a complete rewrite of the Athena astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code. It supports general relativity (GRMHD), radiation transport, and adaptive mesh refinement (AMR), widely used for astrophysical plasma simulations.

tools.name: pyvpic
tools.one_line_profile: Python tools for VPIC data analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: pyvpic provides a Python interface and utilities for accessing, analyzing, and visualizing output data from the VPIC (Vector Particle-In-Cell) simulation code.

tools.name: Quill
tools.one_line_profile: 3D QED-PIC code for laser-plasma interaction
tools.detailed_description: Quill is a 3D Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code that incorporates Quantum Electrodynamics (QED) effects. It is designed to simulate the interaction of high-intensity electromagnetic radiation with plasmas, including phenomena like gamma photon radiation and pair production.

tools.name: pumi-pic
tools.one_line_profile: Libraries for unstructured mesh PIC simulations on GPUs/CPUs
tools.detailed_description: pumi-pic provides support libraries for performing Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations on unstructured meshes. It is designed to run efficiently on both CPUs and GPUs, handling mesh management and particle tracking.

tools.name: GMGPolar
tools.one_line_profile: High Order Geometric Multigrid solver for curvilinear coordinates
tools.detailed_description: GMGPolar implements high-order geometric multigrid methods for solving partial differential equations on planes in curvilinear coordinates, useful for specific geometries in scientific computing.

tools.name: Plasma-Simulation-Code
tools.one_line_profile: 1D kinetic particle-in-cell code with Monte-Carlo collisions
tools.detailed_description: This is a bounded one-dimensional kinetic Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code that includes Monte-Carlo collision models and secondary electron emission, suitable for simulating bounded plasma systems.

tools.name: ChemPlasKin
tools.one_line_profile: 0D solver for unified gas-plasma kinetics simulations
tools.detailed_description: ChemPlasKin is a zero-dimensional (global) solver designed for unified simulations of gas and plasma kinetics. It models the chemical kinetics of species in a plasma environment.

tools.name: Smilei
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma simulation
tools.detailed_description: Smilei is a Particle-In-Cell code for plasma simulation. It is open-source, collaborative, user-friendly and designed for high-performance computing on super-computers.

tools.name: OSHUN
tools.one_line_profile: Vlasov-Fokker-Planck plasma simulation code
tools.detailed_description: OSHUN is a Vlasov-Fokker-Planck code designed for plasma simulations, developed by the UCLA Plasma Simulation Group.

tools.name: PIC-skeleton-codes
tools.one_line_profile: Educational and foundational Particle-In-Cell (PIC) plasma simulation codes
tools.detailed_description: A collection of succinct, fully-functional Particle-In-Cell plasma simulation codes implementing core algorithms with various parallelization strategies (MPI, OpenMP, CUDA).

tools.name: UPIC-2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for building parallel particle-in-cell codes
tools.detailed_description: UPIC 2.0 is a framework of trusted components for building and customizing parallel particle-in-cell (PIC) codes for plasma simulation.

tools.name: IonSolver
tools.one_line_profile: MHD simulation software with GPU acceleration
tools.detailed_description: IonSolver is a magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) simulation software featuring an extended Lattice Boltzmann method and GPU acceleration.

tools.name: POD-Galerkin_MHD
tools.one_line_profile: Data-driven reduced-order modeling for MHD plasmas
tools.detailed_description: Codes for calculating dimensionalized Proper Orthogonal Decomposition (POD) and using SINDy to build data-driven reduced-order models for plasma simulations (e.g., NIMROD).

tools.name: Gkeyll
tools.one_line_profile: Computational plasma physics package (Gkeyll 1.0)
tools.detailed_description: The Gkeyll Computational Plasma Physics Package, implementing Discontinuous Galerkin methods for kinetic and fluid plasma equations.

tools.name: Gkeyll 2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Next-generation computational plasma physics code
tools.detailed_description: The main source repository for the Gkeyll 2.0 code, a framework for solving kinetic and fluid equations in plasma physics.

tools.name: Postgkyl
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing and visualization tool for Gkeyll data
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for post-processing, analyzing, and visualizing data generated by the Gkeyll plasma simulation framework.

tools.name: COOLFluiD
tools.one_line_profile: Object-oriented HPC platform for CFD and plasma simulations
tools.detailed_description: COOLFluiD is an open-source HPC platform for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), plasma, and multi-physics simulations.

tools.name: openPMD-resampler
tools.one_line_profile: Resampling tools for openPMD particle-in-cell (PIC) simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolset for processing and resampling data stored in the openPMD standard, commonly used in particle-in-cell simulations for plasma physics.

tools.name: BOUT++
tools.one_line_profile: Plasma fluid finite-difference simulation framework in curvilinear coordinates
tools.detailed_description: A framework for writing fluid and plasma simulations in curvilinear geometry, widely used for tokamak edge plasma simulations (SOL/divertor).

tools.name: SD1D
tools.one_line_profile: One-dimensional plasma-neutral simulation solver for SOL and divertor studies
tools.detailed_description: A specialized 1D solver built on the BOUT++ framework for simulating plasma-neutral interactions in the Scrape-Off Layer (SOL) and divertor regions.

tools.name: Hermes
tools.one_line_profile: Plasma transport and turbulence model implementation for BOUT++
tools.detailed_description: A 2D and 3D plasma transport and turbulence model built using the BOUT++ framework, designed for fusion plasma boundary simulations.

tools.name: Hypnotoad
tools.one_line_profile: Grid generator for BOUT++ plasma simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based grid generation tool specifically designed to create curvilinear meshes for BOUT++ simulations from equilibrium files.

tools.name: xBOUT
tools.one_line_profile: Data collection and analysis library for BOUT++ using xarray
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to collect, normalize, and analyze data from parallelized BOUT++ simulations, providing an xarray interface for post-processing.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-MHD-VoF-Solver-Collection
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of modified OpenFOAM solvers for MHD and VoF simulations
tools.detailed_description: A set of custom solvers for OpenFOAM focusing on Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) and Volume of Fluid (VoF) multiphase flows.

tools.name: Phantom
tools.one_line_profile: Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, modular, and efficient code for Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) and Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulations, primarily for astrophysics.

tools.name: ppiclF
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Particle-In-Cell (PIC) library in Fortran
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran library designed to facilitate the development of parallel Particle-In-Cell (PIC) codes, handling particle data structures and parallel communication.

tools.name: Entity
tools.one_line_profile: New generation astrophysical plasma simulation code with CPU/GPU portability
tools.detailed_description: Entity is a high-performance plasma simulation code designed for astrophysical contexts, featuring portability across CPU and GPU architectures. It likely employs particle-in-cell (PIC) or hybrid methods for simulating plasma dynamics.

tools.name: DiMagno
tools.one_line_profile: 2D two-fluid simulation code for divergent magnetic nozzles
tools.detailed_description: DiMagno is a MATLAB-based solver for simulating 2D two-fluid plasma dynamics in divergent magnetic nozzles, useful for propulsion and plasma expansion studies.

tools.name: FuMagno
tools.one_line_profile: 3D fully magnetized magnetic nozzle simulation code
tools.detailed_description: FuMagno is a MATLAB tool for simulating 3D fully magnetized magnetic nozzles, complementing DiMagno by extending analysis to three-dimensional geometries in plasma propulsion contexts.

tools.name: EPOCH
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: EPOCH is a leading relativistic Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code used for simulating laser-plasma interactions and other high-energy density physics phenomena. It supports 1D, 2D, and 3D simulations with advanced physics packages.

tools.name: ADEPT
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic-Differentiation-Enabled Plasma Transport in JAX
tools.detailed_description: ADEPT is a plasma transport simulation tool leveraging JAX for automatic differentiation, enabling gradient-based optimization and machine learning integration for kinetic plasma modeling.

tools.name: FBPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral, quasi-3D Particle-In-Cell code for CPU and GPU
tools.detailed_description: FBPIC (Fourier-Bessel Particle-In-Cell) is a PIC code that uses a spectral cylindrical representation to perform quasi-3D simulations of laser-wakefield acceleration and plasma interactions efficiently on CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: FreeGS
tools.one_line_profile: Free boundary Grad-Shafranov solver for tokamak equilibrium
tools.detailed_description: FreeGS is a Python library for solving the free-boundary Grad-Shafranov equation, used to calculate the plasma equilibrium configuration in tokamaks given coil currents and plasma profiles.

tools.name: Aurora
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for impurity transport and radiation modeling in plasmas
tools.detailed_description: Aurora is a Python package for modeling particle transport, neutral dynamics, and radiation in magnetically confined plasmas, facilitating the analysis of impurity behavior in fusion devices.

tools.name: Fusion Surrogates
tools.one_line_profile: Library of surrogate transport models for tokamak fusion
tools.detailed_description: A library developed by Google DeepMind providing surrogate models for tokamak transport simulations, designed to accelerate fusion plasma modeling using machine learning techniques.

tools.name: TORAX
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable tokamak transport simulation in JAX
tools.detailed_description: TORAX is a differentiable tokamak transport simulator built on JAX, enabling fast, gradient-based optimization and control design for fusion plasma scenarios.

tools.name: Gyselalib++
tools.one_line_profile: Components for gyrokinetic semi-lagrangian codes
tools.detailed_description: Gyselalib++ provides a set of C++ components and abstractions for building high-performance gyrokinetic semi-Lagrangian plasma simulation codes, focusing on modularity and HPC efficiency.

tools.name: Runko
tools.one_line_profile: Modern C++/Python CPU/GPU plasma toolbox
tools.detailed_description: Runko is a computational toolbox for plasma physics simulations, offering a modern C++ core with Python bindings and support for heterogeneous computing (CPU/GPU) to model plasma dynamics.

tools.name: SIMSOPT
tools.one_line_profile: Simons Stellarator Optimizer Code
tools.detailed_description: SIMSOPT is a framework for optimizing stellarator fusion devices, integrating equilibrium, stability, and transport calculations to design magnetic configurations for plasma confinement.

tools.name: SALAMANDER
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics application for magnetic confinement fusion energy systems
tools.detailed_description: SALAMANDER is an engineering-scale and microstructure-scale multiphysics calculation tool developed by Idaho National Laboratory. It is designed for simulating magnetic confinement fusion energy systems, likely leveraging the MOOSE framework for coupled physics problems.

tools.name: Idefix
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable finite volume MHD code using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: Idefix is a finite volume code designed for astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulations. It leverages the Kokkos performance portability library to run efficiently on various architectures, including GPUs and many-core CPUs.

tools.name: COPTIC
tools.one_line_profile: 3-D PIC plasma simulation code for oblique boundaries
tools.detailed_description: COPTIC (Cartesian-coordinate Oblique-boundary Particles and Thermals In Cell) is a specialized 3-D Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed to simulate plasma interactions with embedded objects, handling complex geometries and boundary conditions.

tools.name: Imogen
tools.one_line_profile: Magnetohydrodynamics code for astrophysical simulations
tools.detailed_description: Imogen is a MATLAB-based Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulation code tailored for astrophysical contexts. It provides tools for solving fluid equations in the presence of magnetic fields.

tools.name: PCSSP
tools.one_line_profile: Plasma Control System Simulation Platform for ITER
tools.detailed_description: PCSSP (Plasma Control System Simulation Platform) is a simulation environment developed by the ITER Organization. It is used to design, test, and validate plasma control algorithms and systems for the ITER tokamak.

tools.name: SOLPS-ITER
tools.one_line_profile: Scrape-Off Layer Plasma Simulation Code for ITER
tools.detailed_description: SOLPS-ITER is the standard code package used by the ITER Organization for simulating the Scrape-Off Layer (SOL) and divertor plasma. It models the transport of plasma and neutrals in the boundary region of fusion devices.

tools.name: AI_tokamak_control
tools.one_line_profile: AI-based autonomous control design for tokamak fusion plasma
tools.detailed_description: This tool provides an AI/Reinforcement Learning framework for designing autonomous operation and control strategies for tokamak fusion plasmas, aiming to optimize plasma stability and performance.

tools.name: KSTAR_tokamak_simulator
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network-based simulator for the KSTAR tokamak
tools.detailed_description: A data-driven simulator for the KSTAR nuclear fusion reactor, utilizing LSTM-based neural networks (KSTAR-NN) to model plasma dynamics and predict system states for control and analysis.

tools.name: vae_mhd_solver
tools.one_line_profile: VAE-based neural network solver for ideal MHD equilibrium
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning tool that uses a Variational Autoencoder (VAE) architecture to solve the Grad-Shafranov equation for ideal MHD equilibrium in tokamak geometries, accelerating equilibrium reconstruction.

tools.name: SWIRL
tools.one_line_profile: Automated vortex identification in velocity fields
tools.detailed_description: SWIRL is a Python implementation of the 'Estimated Vortex Center' (EVC) method. It automates the identification and characterization of vortices in two-dimensional velocity fields, useful for fluid dynamics and plasma turbulence analysis.

tools.name: VlaPy
tools.one_line_profile: 1D-1V Vlasov-Poisson plasma physics simulation tool
tools.detailed_description: VlaPy is a Python-based simulation tool for solving the Vlasov-Poisson (and Fokker-Planck) equations in 1D-1V phase space. It utilizes NumPy for computation and MLFlow for experiment management, suitable for kinetic plasma studies.

tools.name: Plasma.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface for accelerated plasma simulations
tools.detailed_description: Plasma.jl is a Julia package designed for the accelerated simulation of high-dimensional collisionless and electrostatic plasmas. It provides an interface for solving kinetic equations and particle dynamics.

tools.name: DeepEEG
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning tool for EEG data analysis
tools.detailed_description: DeepEEG is a library for applying deep learning techniques to Electroencephalography (EEG) data. It integrates with MNE-Python epoch objects to facilitate the training of TensorFlow models for neurological signal analysis.

tools.name: nubhlight
tools.one_line_profile: GR-RMHD code for neutron star merger disks
tools.detailed_description: nubhlight is a General Relativistic Radiation Magnetohydrodynamics (GR-RMHD) code developed at LANL. It is specialized for simulating neutrino radiation and plasma dynamics in the extreme environments of neutron star merger disks.

tools.name: VPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Vector Particle-In-Cell (VPIC) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: VPIC is a high-performance, relativistic, fully kinetic Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code developed by Los Alamos National Laboratory. It is designed for large-scale plasma simulations on supercomputers, modeling laser-plasma interactions, magnetic reconnection, and fusion devices.

tools.name: VPIC-Kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos-based portable version of VPIC
tools.detailed_description: VPIC-Kokkos is a port of the VPIC code using the Kokkos performance portability framework. It enables the VPIC simulation engine to run efficiently on a wide range of modern hardware architectures, including various GPUs and multicore CPUs.

tools.name: lcodePy
tools.one_line_profile: Quasistatic plasma wakefield simulation code
tools.detailed_description: lcodePy is a Python-based simulation code for modeling quasistatic plasma wakefield acceleration. It supports 2D and 3D geometries and offers implementations for both CPUs and GPUs, facilitating research in advanced accelerator concepts.

tools.name: Legolas
tools.one_line_profile: Modern tool for MHD spectroscopy
tools.detailed_description: Legolas is a numerical code designed for Magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) spectroscopy. It calculates the spectrum of MHD waves and instabilities in 1D equilibria, used for analyzing solar and laboratory plasmas.

tools.name: XENON
tools.one_line_profile: Matrix-based dispersion relation solver for plasma physics
tools.detailed_description: XENON is a Python tool that solves the plasma dispersion relation using a matrix-based approach. It is used to analyze wave propagation and instabilities in various plasma conditions.

tools.name: PlasmaNet
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network solver for elliptic equations in plasma fluids
tools.detailed_description: PlasmaNet applies deep learning techniques to solve elliptic differential equations (like the Poisson equation) within plasma fluid simulations. It aims to accelerate traditional solvers using neural networks.

tools.name: UEDGE
tools.one_line_profile: 2D fluid simulation of plasma and neutrals in fusion devices
tools.detailed_description: UEDGE is a 2D multi-species fluid code developed by LLNL for simulating plasma and neutral transport in the edge region of magnetic fusion devices. It is widely used for divertor design and edge plasma physics studies.

tools.name: lcode3d
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated 3D quasistatic plasma wakefield code
tools.detailed_description: lcode3d is a concise, GPU-accelerated simulation code for 3D quasistatic plasma wakefield acceleration. It is designed for high efficiency and ease of use in modeling beam-plasma interactions.

tools.name: MagIC
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance solver for magneto-hydrodynamics equations in rotating spherical shells
tools.detailed_description: MagIC is a code designed to solve the magneto-hydrodynamics (MHD) equations in rotating spherical shells using a pseudo-spectral method. It is widely used for simulating planetary and stellar dynamos.

tools.name: ATHENA
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for parameter space reduction and active subspaces in numerical analysis
tools.detailed_description: ATHENA (Advanced Techniques for High dimensional parameter spaces to Enhance Numerical Analysis) implements parameter space reduction techniques such as Active Subspaces to facilitate the analysis of high-dimensional scientific simulations.

tools.name: RT_GS2
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of the GS2 gyrokinetic code for plasma turbulence
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains an implementation of GS2, a code for simulating gyrokinetic plasma turbulence, likely optimized or modified for specific runtime requirements (RT).

tools.name: mhdvanleer
tools.one_line_profile: Magnetohydrodynamics simulation code using Van Leer flux splitting
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code for solving magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) equations, utilizing numerical schemes like Van Leer flux splitting for fluid dynamics problems.

tools.name: AMoRE
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid Vlasov-Fokker-Planck code for relativistic electron beam transport
tools.detailed_description: AMoRE is a hybrid Vlasov-Fokker-Planck code designed for fast simulations of relativistic electron beam transport in denser solids or plasmas.

tools.name: ESVM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite-volume Vlasov-Maxwell code for plasma physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: ESVM is a simulation code that solves the Vlasov-Maxwell system using finite-volume methods, suitable for studying kinetic plasma phenomena.

tools.name: MLAU
tools.one_line_profile: Low-dissipation Riemann solver for Ideal Magnetohydrodynamics
tools.detailed_description: Implements the Multistate Low-dissipation Advection Upstream Splitting Method (MLAU), a low-dissipation HLLD approximate Riemann solver for ideal MHD simulations across a wide range of Mach numbers.

tools.name: qasMHD
tools.one_line_profile: Quasi all-speed magnetohydrodynamic simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code designed for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) that operates effectively across various speed regimes (quasi all-speed).

tools.name: neural-gyrokinetics
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning tools for accelerating plasma turbulence simulations
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit leveraging machine learning methods to accelerate high-dimensional gyrokinetic plasma turbulence simulations, bridging AI and computational plasma physics.

tools.name: PiCLES
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-In-Cell model for surface waves in Earth Systems
tools.detailed_description: PiCLES (Particle-In-CelL for Efficient Swell) is a surface wave model using the Particle-In-Cell method, designed for efficiency in Earth System Models.

tools.name: maelstrom
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical simulation of magnetohydrodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool for the numerical simulation of magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) problems.

tools.name: TRISTAN-MP
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Particle-in-Cell code for plasma physics
tools.detailed_description: TRISTAN-MP is a parallelized Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code used for simulating plasma physics phenomena, particularly in astrophysical contexts.

tools.name: OpenPixi
tools.one_line_profile: Open Colored Particle-in-Cell (CPIC) simulator
tools.detailed_description: OpenPixi is an open-source Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulator designed for educational and research purposes in plasma physics.

tools.name: OSIRIS
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel fully relativistic Particle-in-Cell code
tools.detailed_description: OSIRIS is a state-of-the-art, fully relativistic, massively parallel Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code widely used for plasma accelerator research and astrophysics.

tools.name: AthenaPK
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable MHD code based on Athena++ and Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: AthenaPK is a performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysics magnetohydrodynamics code, built using the Parthenon framework and Kokkos for execution on diverse HPC architectures.

tools.name: Starfish
tools.one_line_profile: 2D PIC-DSMC plasma and rarefied gas simulation program
tools.detailed_description: Starfish is a simulation tool for plasma and rarefied gas dynamics, utilizing both Particle-in-Cell (PIC) and Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) methods.

tools.name: vmf90
tools.one_line_profile: Vlasov solver for mean-field systems
tools.detailed_description: vmf90 is a Fortran 90 code designed to solve the Vlasov equation for mean-field systems, applicable in plasma physics and stellar dynamics.

tools.name: GIZMO
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-physics massively-parallel code for astrophysics and fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: GIZMO is a flexible, massively parallel, multi-physics simulation code capable of solving hydrodynamics, MHD, and gravity, widely used in astrophysics.

tools.name: gkc
tools.one_line_profile: Gyrokinetic simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A gyrokinetic code implemented in C++/Cilk+, designed for simulating plasma dynamics in fusion devices.

tools.name: PICLas
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel 3D PIC-DSMC solver for plasma simulation
tools.detailed_description: PICLas is a high-performance, parallel, three-dimensional Particle-in-Cell (PIC) and Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) solver for simulating plasma and gas flows.

tools.name: PICMI
tools.one_line_profile: Standard input format and Python interface for Particle-In-Cell codes
tools.detailed_description: PICMI (Particle-In-Cell Modeling Interface) defines a standard Python API and input format for configuring and running various Particle-In-Cell codes, promoting interoperability.

tools.name: UAThorns
tools.one_line_profile: General relativistic magnetohydrodynamics (GRMHD) simulation codes
tools.detailed_description: A collection of codes for general relativistic magnetohydrodynamics simulations, including extensions to IllinoisGRMHD for finite temperature EOS, working within the EinsteinToolkit.

tools.name: euler_kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible hydro and MHD solver using MPI+Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: Implements 2nd order Godunov schemes for compressible hydrodynamics and magnetohydrodynamics (MHD), utilizing MPI and Kokkos for performance portability.

tools.name: ppkMHD
tools.one_line_profile: High-order spectral difference MHD solver with MPI+Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: An MPI+Kokkos implementation of the spectral difference method (SDM) for high-order magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulations.

tools.name: ramsesGPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-optimized astrophysics MHD simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A version of the RAMSES astrophysics MHD simulation code optimized for execution on large GPU clusters.

tools.name: SPHERE
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral code for MHD equations in spheres
tools.detailed_description: SPHERE (SPectral cHandrasEkhaR-kEndall spherical code) is a research code that solves magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) equations inside spheres using a purely spectral method.

tools.name: constrainedtransport-python
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Volume Constrained Transport MHD solver
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of a Finite Volume Constrained Transport algorithm for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulations, often used for educational or reference purposes.

tools.name: pic-python
tools.one_line_profile: Vectorized Plasma Particle-in-Cell code
tools.detailed_description: A compact, vectorized Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code written in Python, suitable for small-scale plasma simulations and educational demonstrations of PIC algorithms.

tools.name: GTC Benchmark
tools.one_line_profile: Gyrokinetic Toroidal Code (GTC) benchmark version
tools.detailed_description: Contains the source code for the Gyrokinetic Toroidal Code (GTC), a 3D PIC code for simulating microturbulence in magnetically confined fusion plasmas.

tools.name: PSC
tools.one_line_profile: The PSC particle-in-cell code
tools.detailed_description: PSC is a Particle-In-Cell code designed for plasma physics simulations, supporting various configurations and parallel execution.

tools.name: PUNCpp
tools.one_line_profile: Particles-in-UNstructured-Cells (PIC) code
tools.detailed_description: PUNCpp is a C++ implementation of a Particle-in-Cell code designed to work with unstructured grids (Particles-in-UNstructured-Cells).

tools.name: pyrokinetics
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for analyzing and running gyrokinetic turbulence simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to standardize the analysis and execution of gyrokinetic simulations. It supports multiple gyrokinetic codes (like GS2, CGYRO, GENE) through a unified interface, facilitating data reading, normalization, and plotting of simulation results.

tools.name: plasmaArc
tools.one_line_profile: Simple Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A solver implementation for the OpenFOAM framework designed to simulate magnetohydrodynamic flows, specifically targeting plasma arc phenomena. It extends OpenFOAM's capabilities to handle electromagnetic fields coupled with fluid dynamics.

tools.name: Quokka
tools.one_line_profile: Two-moment AMR radiation hydrodynamics code for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: A block-structured Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) code that solves the equations of radiation hydrodynamics with self-gravity, particles, chemistry, and magnetic fields. It is optimized for GPUs and designed for high-performance astrophysical simulations.

tools.name: PICTOR
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based Particle-in-Cell code designed for simulating plasma dynamics. It implements core PIC algorithms to model the interaction of charged particles with electromagnetic fields.

tools.name: apic2d
tools.one_line_profile: 2D Affine Particle-in-Cell (APIC) fluid simulation solver
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Affine Particle-in-Cell (APIC) method for 2D fluid simulation. While often used in computer graphics, it represents a rigorous physics-based numerical solver for fluid dynamics.

tools.name: libwetcloth
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-scale physics model for liquid-fabric interactions
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing a multi-scale numerical model to simulate the physical interaction between liquids and porous fabrics, utilizing physics-based modeling techniques.

tools.name: EPEC
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of magnetic island dynamics in tokamaks
tools.detailed_description: A scientific program designed to simulate multi-harmonic magnetic island dynamics in the presence of resonant magnetic perturbations within a time-varying toroidal tokamak equilibrium. Developed for fusion plasma research.

tools.name: ZPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Educational Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code suite
tools.detailed_description: A suite of Particle-in-Cell codes (1D/2D, electrostatic/electromagnetic) designed for educational and research purposes to demonstrate and run plasma physics simulations.

tools.name: XOOPIC
tools.one_line_profile: 2D-3V Particle-in-Cell plasma simulator
tools.detailed_description: An object-oriented Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for simulating plasmas. It handles electrostatic and electromagnetic models, supports various boundary conditions, and includes gas chemistry capabilities.

tools.name: imhd-CUDA
tools.one_line_profile: CUDA implementation of Ideal MHD solver
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA C implementation of the Lax-Wendroff numerical scheme for solving Ideal Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) equations in 3D, enabling GPU-accelerated plasma simulations.

tools.name: PICSP
tools.one_line_profile: Structured mesh Particle-in-Cell plasma simulation code
tools.detailed_description: An open-source scientific program for simulating plasmas using the Particle-In-Cell (PIC) method on a structured mesh, suitable for studying plasma dynamics.

tools.name: Selalib
tools.one_line_profile: Semi-Lagrangian library for kinetic plasma simulations
tools.detailed_description: A library of modular Fortran components for the numerical simulation of the Vlasov equation using Semi-Lagrangian methods, primarily for plasma physics applications.

tools.name: mhd_pino
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural Operators for MHD equations
tools.detailed_description: A tool utilizing Physics-Informed Neural Operators (PINOs) to solve Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) equations, representing an AI-for-Science approach to plasma modeling.

tools.name: gdpy3
tools.one_line_profile: Data processing tools for Gyrokinetic Toroidal Code (GTC)
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing data processing and analysis utilities specifically for the Gyrokinetic Toroidal Code (GTC), a major fusion simulation code.

tools.name: GAN-metrics
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation metrics for Generative Adversarial Networks
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for calculating various performance metrics for Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), supporting the evaluation of generative models often used in scientific data synthesis.

tools.name: SimPla
tools.one_line_profile: Plasma simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A C++ framework designed for performing plasma simulations, likely implementing particle or fluid-based methods for fusion and plasma physics research.

tools.name: postpic
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processor for Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for post-processing and analyzing data from Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations. It supports various file formats and provides tools for calculating physical quantities and visualizing results.

tools.name: Athena
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for defending ML systems against adversarial attacks
tools.detailed_description: An extensible framework for evaluating and deploying defenses against adversarial attacks on machine learning models, supporting robust AI research.

tools.name: SpacePy
tools.one_line_profile: Space science library for Python
tools.detailed_description: A library for space science applications, providing tools for data analysis, modeling, and visualization, including magnetic field models, drift shell tracing, and time coordinate conversions.

tools.name: stella
tools.one_line_profile: Flux tube gyrokinetic code for plasma turbulence
tools.detailed_description: A flux tube gyrokinetic code designed for simulating micro-stability and turbulence in strongly magnetised plasmas, used in fusion research.

tools.name: WAND-PIC
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A Particle-in-Cell code for plasma simulation, implementing core algorithms for charged particle dynamics in electromagnetic fields.

tools.name: GSFit
tools.one_line_profile: Grad-Shafranov equilibrium fitting code
tools.detailed_description: A Rust-based tool for solving the Grad-Shafranov equation to reconstruct plasma equilibrium configurations in tokamaks, developed by Tokamak Energy.

tools.name: rtgsfit
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time Grad-Shafranov equilibrium reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based code for real-time reconstruction of plasma equilibrium in tokamaks using the Grad-Shafranov equation, suitable for control systems and rapid analysis.

tools.name: ReMKiT1D
tools.one_line_profile: 1D multifluid and kinetic plasma simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework developed by UKAEA for 1D multifluid and kinetic simulations, specifically geared towards modeling Scrape-Off Layer (SOL) plasmas in fusion devices.

tools.name: Underworld2
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel PIC finite element code for geodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, particle-in-cell, finite element code designed for large-scale geodynamics simulations. It allows for the modeling of complex fluid flows and material deformation.

tools.name: ESSOS
tools.one_line_profile: e-Stellarator Simulation and Optimization Suite
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for the simulation and optimization of stellarator fusion devices, facilitating design and analysis of magnetic confinement configurations.

tools.name: JAX-in-Cell
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable 1D3V Particle-in-Cell code in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code implemented in JAX, enabling differentiable plasma simulations. This allows for gradient-based optimization and integration with machine learning workflows.

tools.name: Kinetic.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for kinetic theory and fluid mechanics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library for modeling and simulating fluid mechanics based on the Boltzmann equation and kinetic theory. It supports multiscale flows and integrates with machine learning for scientific computing.

tools.name: SOMAFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: Low-temperature plasma simulation framework on foam-extend
tools.detailed_description: A simulation framework built upon foam-extend (OpenFOAM fork) specifically for modeling low-temperature plasmas, handling the coupling of fluid dynamics with plasma chemistry and electromagnetics.

tools.name: SPECTRUM

tools.detailed_description: A C++ code for simulating the transport of energetic charged particles in space plasmas using unstructured meshes, relevant for space weather and astrophysical plasma research.

tools.name: PANTERA

It combines Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) and Particle-in-Cell (PIC) methods to model nonequilibrium gas and plasma flows, suitable for rarefied gas dynamics and plasma physics research.

tools.name: ALCON

tools.name: pic1dp

tools.name: xsuite

tools.name: vlp4d

tools.detailed_description: vlp4d is a high-performance simulation code for solving the 4D Vlasov-Poisson system, governing collisionless plasma dynamics. It features advanced parallelization using OpenACC and Kokkos for execution on heterogeneous computing architectures.

tools.name: GEM0

tools.name: tokamesh

tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to construct meshes and geometry matrices specifically for tomography problems in tokamak fusion devices, facilitating plasma diagnostic analysis.

tools.name: freegs4e

tools.detailed_description: A solver for the Grad-Shafranov equation focusing on free boundary conditions and time evolution, used for modeling plasma equilibrium in fusion devices.

tools.name: TextDescriptives

tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing routines for working with Magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) equilibrium, essential for plasma physics and fusion reactor modeling.

tools.name: Describe Anything

tools.detailed_description: A suite of modeling tools and underlying finite element framework for solving problems in plasma and fusion research and engineering in arbitrary 2D and 3D geometries.

tools.name: ThinWire_MRIGradientCoilDesign

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for designing gradient coils for Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI), utilizing thin-wire approximations for electromagnetic design.

tools.detailed_description: A utility to convert magnetic equilibrium data from the standard EQDSK format into the input format required by the HELENA stability code.

tools.name: descriptastorus
tools.one_line_profile: Chemistry descriptor computation and storage library
tools.detailed_description: A library for computing chemical descriptors and optionally storing them, designed for machine learning applications in chemistry and cheminformatics.

tools.name: cfsem-py

tools.detailed_description: A Python library for quasi-steady electromagnetics modeling, including filamentized approximations, Biot-Savart law calculations, and Grad-Shafranov equilibrium solving, developed by CFS.

tools.name: cfsem-rs
tools.one_line_profile: Rust library for quasi-steady electromagnetics and equilibrium solving in fusion
tools.detailed_description: A library providing tools for quasi-steady electromagnetics, including filamentized approximations, Biot-Savart law calculations, and Grad-Shafranov equilibrium solving, developed by Commonwealth Fusion Systems.

tools.name: interplanetary-grad-shafranov
tools.one_line_profile: Grad-Shafranov reconstruction tool for interplanetary magnetic flux ropes
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolkit for performing Grad-Shafranov reconstruction on interplanetary magnetic flux ropes, useful for analyzing magnetic field structures in space plasma physics.

tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to accelerate Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) for data science, providing tools for data summarization, visualization, and quality assessment.

tools.detailed_description: Code implementation for the paper 'Stein Variational Gradient Descent (SVGD): A General Purpose Bayesian Inference Algorithm', providing a method for variational inference in probabilistic models.

tools.name: LANLGeoMag

tools.detailed_description: A C-based library from Los Alamos National Laboratory providing magnetic field models, coordinate conversions, and tools for magnetic field line tracing and drift shell tracing in geophysical research.

tools.name: room_transfer_function_toolkit

tools.detailed_description: A library for sparse representation of room transfer functions and algorithms for localizing sound sources in a room using a single microphone.

tools.name: grounded-video-description

tools.detailed_description: A research tool for video grounding and captioning, enabling the association of textual descriptions with specific temporal segments in videos.

tools.name: freegs

tools.detailed_description: A Python-based free boundary Grad-Shafranov solver designed to calculate the equilibrium of plasma in magnetic confinement devices like tokamaks.

tools.name: cad_to_dagmc

tools.detailed_description: A tool that converts CAD geometry (STP files) or Cadquery assemblies into DAGMC-compatible h5m files for use in neutronics and fusion simulations.

tools.name: cad_to_h5m

tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that converts CAD files (STP, SAT) to h5m files compatible with DAGMC-based simulations, utilizing the Cubit Python API for geometry processing.

tools.name: paramak

tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for creating parametric 3D CAD models of fusion reactors and automatically generating neutronics models for simulation.

tools.name: omas

tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing an interface for the ITER Integrated Modeling & Analysis Suite (IMAS) data structure, facilitating data exchange and storage in fusion research.

tools.name: CoFF

tools.detailed_description: Implementation of 'Cross-Modal Feature Fusion for Robust Point Cloud Registration with Ambiguous Geometry', a method for aligning 3D point cloud data.

tools.name: gvec

tools.detailed_description: A flexible 3D ideal MHD equilibrium solver using a Galerkin variational approach, designed for generating three-dimensional magnetohydrodynamic equilibria.

tools.name: simsopt

tools.detailed_description: A framework for optimizing stellarator magnetic configurations and other plasma physics problems, developed by the Hidden Symmetries project.

tools.name: efficient-descriptors

tools.detailed_description: Implementation of efficient binary local image descriptors designed for computer vision applications on resource-constrained devices.

tools.name: DiffVAE

tools.detailed_description: Code for the paper 'Unsupervised generative and graph neural methods for modelling cell differentiation', providing a VAE-based approach to model biological processes.

tools.name: LFASR-FS-GAF

tools.name: gradient-descent-the-ultimate-optimizer

tools.detailed_description: A repository containing MATLAB routines and wrappers for interacting with the VMEC (Variational Moments Equilibrium Code) MHD equilibrium solver.

tools.detailed_description: Code for the paper 'HELENA: High-Efficiency Learning-Based Channel Estimation Using Neural Attention', providing tools for channel estimation in telecommunications.

tools.name: GITR
tools.one_line_profile: Global Impurity Transport code for fusion devices
tools.detailed_description: GITR (Global Impurity Transport) is a C++ code developed by ORNL for simulating the transport of impurities in fusion devices. It models particle interactions with plasma and plasma-facing components, crucial for understanding erosion, deposition, and plasma contamination in tokamaks.

tools.name: TGLFNN.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface for running TGLF and TGLFNN turbulence models
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package designed to run TGLF (Trapped Gyro-Landau Fluid) and its neural network surrogate (TGLFNN) models. It facilitates the calculation of turbulent transport fluxes in fusion plasmas, supporting both the original physics code and accelerated neural network approximations.

tools.name: MedTrinity-25M
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale multimodal medical dataset with multigranular annotations
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive medical AI dataset and codebase providing 25 million multimodal entries with multigranular annotations. It is designed to support the development of large multimodal models for medicine, facilitating tasks such as medical image analysis and report generation.

tools.name: PLASMA
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and interpretable protein substructure alignment via optimal transport
tools.detailed_description: PLASMA (Protein Local Alignment via Substructure Matching and Alignment) is a tool for aligning protein substructures using optimal transport theory. It provides fast and interpretable alignments, useful for structural biology and protein function prediction.

tools.name: BOLOS
tools.one_line_profile: Boltzmann Equation Solver for Low Temperature Plasmas
tools.detailed_description: An open source Python solver for the Boltzmann equation, typically used in plasma physics to calculate electron energy distribution functions (EEDF) and transport coefficients.

tools.name: RAPter
tools.one_line_profile: Rebuilding Man-made Scenes with Regular Arrangements of Planes
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation for 3D scene reconstruction and geometry processing, focusing on regular arrangements of planes in man-made scenes.

tools.name: ASTRA-sim
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed Deep Learning System Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A simulator for modeling hierarchical networks and disaggregated systems to analyze performance of large-model training at scale.

tools.name: ASTRA Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance GPU primitives for 2D and 3D tomography
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB and Python toolbox of high-performance GPU primitives for 2D and 3D tomography, used in X-ray CT and electron tomography.

tools.name: dnaPipeTE
tools.one_line_profile: De-novo assembly & annotation Pipeline for Transposable Elements
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics pipeline designed to find, annotate, and quantify Transposable Elements in small samples of NGS datasets without requiring genome assembly.

tools.name: adept
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic-Differentiation-Enabled Plasma Transport solver using JAX
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for simulating plasma transport phenomena using automatic differentiation via JAX. It is designed to facilitate gradient-based optimization and sensitivity analysis in plasma physics modeling.

tools.name: gacode
tools.one_line_profile: General Atomics Turbulence and Transport Codes Suite
tools.detailed_description: A suite of physics codes for simulating turbulence and transport in fusion plasmas, maintained by General Atomics. It includes industry-standard codes like TGLF (Trapped Gyro-Landau Fluid), NEO, and CGYRO.

tools.name: fusion_surrogates
tools.one_line_profile: Library of surrogate transport models for tokamak fusion simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python library providing pre-trained surrogate models for tokamak plasma transport, designed to accelerate fusion simulations by replacing computationally expensive physics codes with fast neural network approximations.

tools.name: Raptor
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based sequence mapping tool for long reads
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics tool for mapping long DNA sequences (such as those from PacBio or Nanopore) using a graph-based approach. It is designed to handle noisy or HiFi reads efficiently.

tools.name: RaptorX-3DModeling
tools.one_line_profile: Protein structure prediction system using deep learning
tools.detailed_description: A software package for protein structure prediction, utilizing deep learning and threading techniques to predict 3D models from protein sequences. Part of the RaptorX suite.

tools.name: RaptorX-Contact
tools.one_line_profile: Deep residual neural network for protein contact prediction
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning tool for predicting protein contact maps and distance matrices, which are critical for accurate 3D structure reconstruction.

tools.name: Generative Agents
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for interactive simulacra of human behavior
tools.detailed_description: A research platform for simulating believable human behavior using generative agents powered by large language models. It enables computational social science experiments and behavioral modeling.

tools.name: GATT_DNS
tools.one_line_profile: Direct Numerical Simulation code for compressible Navier-Stokes equations with stability analysis
tools.detailed_description: A DNS code for compressible Navier-Stokes equations featuring Jacobian-free time-stepping for linear stability analysis (LST), developed by the Group of Aeroacoustics, Transition and Turbulence.

tools.name: RAPT
tools.one_line_profile: Read Assembly and Annotation Pipeline Tool for microbial genomes
tools.detailed_description: NCBI's pipeline tool for the assembly and annotation of microbial genomic reads.

tools.name: nekStab
tools.one_line_profile: Global linear stability analysis toolbox for the Nek5000 spectral element solver
tools.detailed_description: An open-source toolbox based on Krylov methods for performing highly parallel global linear stability analysis of incompressible flow problems using Nek5000.

tools.name: Trinity
tools.one_line_profile: Programmable 3D fluid dynamics simulator in WebGL
tools.detailed_description: A real-time, programmable 3D fluid simulator that runs in the browser using WebGL, allowing for visualization and experimentation with fluid dynamics equations.

tools.name: Raptor (RL-Tools)
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation policy and control framework for quadrotors
tools.detailed_description: A foundation policy and reinforcement learning framework for robust and adaptive quadrotor control, enabling agile flight in challenging environments.

tools.name: RAPTOR (RoahmLab)
tools.one_line_profile: Rapid and Robust Trajectory Optimization for Robots
tools.detailed_description: A trajectory optimization library for robots, focusing on rapid and robust path planning and control.

tools.name: Raptor (SeqAn)
tools.one_line_profile: Fast pre-filter for querying large collections of nucleotide sequences
tools.detailed_description: A fast and space-efficient pre-filter designed for querying very large collections of nucleotide sequences, useful in bioinformatics for sequence search and analysis.

tools.name: Astral
tools.one_line_profile: Calculations for the position of the sun and moon
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for calculating the position of the sun and moon, as well as moon phases, useful for astronomical and environmental applications.

tools.name: ASTRAL
tools.one_line_profile: Accurate Species TRee ALgorithm for phylogenetics
tools.detailed_description: A tool for estimating a species tree from a set of unrooted gene trees, widely used in phylogenetics and evolutionary biology.

tools.name: AlphaZero General
tools.one_line_profile: General implementation of AlphaZero for reinforcement learning research
tools.detailed_description: A clean, general-purpose implementation of the AlphaZero algorithm, serving as a framework for reinforcement learning research across various game environments.

tools.name: Trinity IE
tools.one_line_profile: Information extraction pipeline for NLP
tools.detailed_description: An information extraction pipeline that includes coreference resolution, named entity linking, and relationship extraction, used for NLP research and data processing.

tools.name: Transit Routing
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithms and data structures for public transit routing optimization
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing implementations of public transit routing algorithms (such as CSA and RAPTOR) and data handling utilities, developed by the Transportation Networks Lab.

tools.name: Trinity XAI
tools.one_line_profile: Explainable AI analysis and 3D visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for analyzing and visualizing the behavior of AI models to enhance explainability, featuring 3D visualization capabilities for complex model structures or data.

tools.name: Trinity RNA-Seq
tools.one_line_profile: De novo transcriptome assembler for RNA-Seq data
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive method for de novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-Seq data, capable of resolving alternative splicing isoforms without a reference genome.

tools.name: TM
tools.one_line_profile: MHD code for simulating tearing mode instability
tools.detailed_description: A full Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code designed to simulate tearing mode instabilities in slab geometry, used for studying plasma stability.

tools.name: ST-Raptor
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-Powered Semi-Structured Table Question Answering
tools.detailed_description: A system leveraging Large Language Models to perform question answering on semi-structured tables, facilitating data extraction and analysis from tabular data sources.

tools.name: GS2Mesh

tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of the ECCV 2024 paper 'GS2Mesh', providing a method for surface reconstruction from Gaussian Splatting via novel stereo views.

tools.name: FIDASIM

tools.detailed_description: A code that simulates the signals collected by fast-ion diagnostics in tokamak fusion devices. It models Neutral Beam Injection (NBI) and the resulting fast-ion distribution to predict diagnostic signals.

tools.name: BME-X (Brain MRI Enhancement)
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for brain MRI enhancement and downstream tasks
tools.detailed_description: A foundation model designed to enhance magnetic resonance images (MRI) of the brain, supporting downstream tasks such as segmentation, registration, and diagnosis.

tools.name: hiperseis

tools.detailed_description: A system for processing large-scale seismological data and metadata, developed by Geoscience Australia, facilitating high-performance analysis of seismic signals.

tools.name: MuRAT

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based code for performing multi-resolution seismic attenuation tomography, allowing for the imaging of subsurface attenuation structures.

tools.name: eqtools

tools.detailed_description: A Python package developed by PSFC for working with magnetic equilibrium data from tokamak plasmas, supporting data reading, coordinate mapping, and flux surface analysis.

tools.name: Minerva (Land Cover)

tools.detailed_description: A package designed to aid in the fitting and testing of neural network models for land cover data, including pre- and post-processing utilities, compatible with torchgeo datasets.

tools.name: PlasmaPy

tools.detailed_description: An open-source community-driven Python package for plasma research and education, providing common functionality for plasma parameter calculation, transport analysis, and simulation interfaces.

tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library designed for synthetic diagnostics (creating simulated diagnostic data from plasma models) and tomography (inverting experimental data to reconstruct plasma profiles) in nuclear fusion devices.

tools.detailed_description: A Python library for seismic imaging, offering tools for surface wave tomography, receiver functions, and other seismological analysis methods at various scales.

tools.detailed_description: A platform developed by Kitware for geospatial and scientific data analysis and visualization. It provides services for managing datasets and running analysis pipelines.

tools.name: Dakota
